name: cardon

stmt.origin: f0cli(ccrd, c0, con0, cab(hs1, wrex(hs0, con0, wbr(cv(hs0), cen, cv(hs1)))))

body.origin:
|- wcel(cfv(ccrd, c0), con0)

⊢ (card ` c0)∈ On

⊣ ∅ ∈ On

|- wf(ccrd, cab(hs1, wrex(hs0, con0, wbr(cv(hs0), cen, cv(hs1)))), con0)

comment: The cardinal number of a set is an ordinal number. Proposition 10.6(1) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 85. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jan-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 13-Sep-2013.)
